frame.name: Openness
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Useful_location</fen> is accessible to some (possibly generic) <fen>Theme</fen> despite a potential <fen>Barrier</fen>, or is not accessible because of the <fen>Barrier</fen>.
<ex>I left <fex name="Barrier">the door to the lobby</fex> <t>open</t> <fex name="Theme">for you</fex>.</ex> <ex>I left the door <fex name="Useful_location">to the lobby</fex> <t>open</t> for you.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
</def-root>

FE.name: Useful_location
FE.definition: <def-root>The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Barrier
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which a Theme can easily access the <fen>Useful_location</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time when the <fen>Useful_location</fen> is or is not accessible.
<ex><fex name="Barrier">This door</fex> <m>is</m> <t>closed</t> <fex name="tim">every Monday</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: open.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: allowing access, passage, or view; not closed, fastened, or restricted.

lexUnit.name: closed.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not open or allowing access.

lexUnit.name: dark.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: closed (usually referring to a theater)
